text: Bahrain competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Bahrain entered three swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Abdulla Ahmed |align=left|50 m butterfly |26.69 |69 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m butterfly |58.44 |67 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left rowspan=2|Omar Al-Rowaila |align=left|50 m backstroke |28.57 |61 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m backstroke |1:02.96 |60 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Alaa Binrajab |align=left|50 m freestyle |29.55 |76 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m freestyle |1:07.08 |81 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:Bahrain at the World Aquatics Championships World Aquatics Championships
title: Bahrain at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
